edu.biu.scapi.circuits.fastGarbledCircuit

Class ScNativeGarbledBooleanCircuit

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.circuits.fastGarbledCircuit.ScNativeGarbledBooleanCircuit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FastGarbledBooleanCircuit

    public class ScNativeGarbledBooleanCircuit
extends java.lang.Object
implements FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
    A concrete implementation of FastGarbledBooleanCircuit that is a wrapper for a code of SCAPI written in c++y.

    The circuit can be used as a regular circuit in java and the actual calculations are done in the c++ jni dll calling functions in the Native SCAPI library. In some cases, there is a need to get back information that is stored in the java class (such as the garbled tables, input keys, etc). This java wrapper gives us the flexibility to work from java, for example with 2 parties and sending information via the java channel.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Meital Levy)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScNativeGarbledBooleanCircuit

        public ScNativeGarbledBooleanCircuit(java.lang.String fileName,
                             ScNativeGarbledBooleanCircuit.CircuitType type,
                             boolean isNonXorOutputsRequired)
        A constructor that passes the file to the native code in order to create a circuit object. The pointer of the garbled circuit object is saved in this java class in order to refer to in when calling native functions. The constructor also initializes information stored in java as well as in the c++ code.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the circuit file.
        isFreeXor - a flag indicating the use of the optimization of FreeXor
        isRowReduction - a flag indicating the use of the optimization of Row Reduction

    • Method Detail

      • garble

        public FastCircuitCreationValues garble()
        This method generates all the needed keys of the circuit. It then creates the garbled table according to those values.

        Specified by:
        garble in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Returns:
        FastCircuitCreationValues Contains both keys for each input and output wire and the translation table.

      • garble

        public FastCircuitCreationValues garble(byte[] seed)
                                 throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        This method generates all the needed keys of the circuit. It then creates the garbled table according to those values.

        Specified by:
        garble in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        seed - Used as the aes key that generates the wire keys.
        Returns:
        FastCircuitCreationValues Contains both keys for each input and output wire and the translation table.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - In case the seed is an invalid key for the given PRG.

      • getGarbledInputFromUngarbledInput

        public byte[] getGarbledInputFromUngarbledInput(byte[] ungarbledInputBits,
                                       byte[] allInputWireValues,
                                       int partyNumber)
        This method takes an array containing the non garbled values, both keys for all input wires and the party number which the inputs belong to.

        This method then performs the lookup on the allInputWireValues according to the party number and returns the keys of the corresponding input bits.

        Specified by:
        getGarbledInputFromUngarbledInput in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        ungarbledInputBits - An array containing the non garbled value for each input wire of the given party number.
        allInputWireValues - The array containing both garbled values (keys) for each input wire.
        partyNumber - The number of party which the inputs belong to.
        Returns:
        an array containing a single key of each input wire of the given party in a single dimension array. The keys are of the same size which is known in advance.

      • compute

        public byte[] compute()
               throws NotAllInputsSetException
        Computes the circuit using the given inputs.

        It returns an array containing the garbled output. This output can be translated via the #translate() method.

        Specified by:
        compute in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        garbledInput - A single key for each input wire.
        Returns:
        returns an array containing the garbled value of each output wire.
        Throws:
        NotAllInputsSetException - if the given inputs array is not the same size of the inputs for this circuit.

      • verify

        public boolean verify(byte[] allInputWireValues)
        The verify method is used in the case of malicious adversaries.

        For example, Alice constructs n circuits and Bob can verify n-1 of them (of his choice) to confirm that they are indeed garbling of the agreed upon non garbled circuit. In order to verify, Alice has to give Bob both keys for each of the input wires.

        Specified by:
        verify in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        allInputWireValues - An array containing both keys for each input wire, the keys for each wire are given one after the other.
        Returns:
        true if this FastGarbledBooleanCircuit is a garbling the given keys, false if it is not.

      • internalVerify

        public boolean internalVerify(byte[] allInputWireValues,
                     byte[] allOutputWireValues)
        This function behaves exactly as the verify(byte[] allInputWireValues) method except the last part. The verify function verifies that the translation table matches the resulted output garbled values, while this function does not check it but return the resulted output garbled values.
        Specified by:
        internalVerify in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        allInputWireValues - An array containing both keys for each input wire.
        allOutputWireValues - An array containing both keys for each output wire. When calling the function this array should be empty and will be filled during the process of the function.
        Returns:
        true if this GarbledBooleanCircuit is a garbling the given keys, false if it is not.

      • translate

        public byte[] translate(byte[] garbledOutput)
        Translates the garbled output obtained from the compute() function into a meaningful(i.e. 0-1) output.

        This is done in the native code and gets back the result.

        Specified by:
        translate in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        garbledOutput - An array contains the garbled output.
        Returns:
        an array contains the output bit for each output wire.

      • verifiedTranslate

        public byte[] verifiedTranslate(byte[] garbledOutput,
                       byte[] allOutputWireValues)
                         throws CheatAttemptException
        Verifies that the given garbledOutput is valid values according to the given all OutputWireValues.

        Meaning, for each output wire, checks that the garbled wire is one of the two possibilities. Then, translates the garbled output obtained from the compute() function into a meaningful(i.e. 0-1) output.

        Specified by:
        verifiedTranslate in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        garbledOutput - An array contains the garbled output.
        allOutputWireValues - both values for each output wire.
        Returns:
        an array contains the output bit for each output wire.
        Throws:
        CheatAttemptException - if there is a garbledOutput values that is not one of the two possibilities.

      • getGarbledTables

        public GarbledTablesHolder getGarbledTables()
        The garbled tables are stored in the native code circuit for all the gates. This method returns the garbled tables.

        This function is useful if we would like to pass many garbled circuits built on the same boolean circuit.

        This is a compact way to define a circuit, that is, two garbled circuit with the same encryption scheme and the same basic boolean circuit only differ in the garbled tables and the translation table.

        Thus we can hold one garbled circuit for all the circuits and only replace the garbled tables (and the translation tables if necessary). The advantage is that the size of the tables only is much smaller that all the information stored in the circuit (gates and other member variables). The size becomes important when sending large circuits.

        Specified by:
        getGarbledTables in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit

      • setGarbledTables

        public void setGarbledTables(GarbledTablesHolder garbledTables)
        Sets the garbled tables of this circuit in the native code where it is actually stored. This function is useful if we would like to pass many garbled circuits built on the same boolean circuit.

        This is a compact way to define a circuit, that is, two garbled circuit with the same multi encryption scheme and the same basic boolean circuit only differ in the garbled tables and the translation table.

        Thus we can hold one garbled circuit for all the circuits and only replace the garbled tables (and the translation tables if necessary). The advantage is that the size of the tables only is much smaller that all the information stored in the circuit (gates and other member variables). The size becomes important when sending large circuits.

        The receiver of the circuits will set the garbled tables for the relevant circuit.

        Specified by:
        setGarbledTables in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit

      • getTranslationTable

        public byte[] getTranslationTable()
        Returns the translation table of the circuit calculated and stored in the native code.

        This is necessary since the constructor of the circuit may want to pass the translation table to a different party.

        Usually, this will be used when the other party (not the constructor of the circuit) creates a circuit, sets the garbled tables and needs the translation table as well to complete the construction of the circuit.

        Specified by:
        getTranslationTable in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Returns:
        the translation table of the circuit.

      • setTranslationTable

        public void setTranslationTable(byte[] translationTable)
        Sets the translation table of the circuit stored in the native code.

        This is necessary when the garbled tables where set and we would like to compute the circuit later on.

        Specified by:
        setTranslationTable in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        translationTable - This value should match the garbled tables of the circuit.

      • getInputWireIndices

        public int[] getInputWireIndices(int partyNumber)
                          throws NoSuchPartyException
        Returns the input wires' indices of the given party. We only have the number of inputs for each party and thus we copy the relevant indices from the inputIndices for all the parties.
        Specified by:
        getInputWireIndices in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        partyNumber - The number of the party which we need his input wire indices.
        Returns:
        an array contains the indices of the input wires of the given party number.
        Throws:
        NoSuchPartyException - In case the given party number is not valid.

      • verifyTranslationTable

        public boolean verifyTranslationTable(byte[] allOutputWireValues)
        Description copied from interface: FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        This function does the last part of the verify function. It gets both keys of each output wire and checks that their signal bits match the corresponding bit in the translation table.

        The internalVerify function followed by this function are actually executes the whole verify of the circuit.

        Specified by:
        verifyTranslationTable in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Parameters:
        allOutputWireValues - both keys of each output wire. The output values are placed one after another, meaning that the output values are in the following format: [k0,0 k0,1 k1,0 k1,1 k2,0 k2,1 ....] (while k0,1 is key 1 of wire 0).
        Returns:
        true if the given keys match the translation table ,false if not.

      • getInputWireIndices

        public int[] getInputWireIndices()
        Specified by:
        getInputWireIndices in interface FastGarbledBooleanCircuit
        Returns:
        an array containing the indices of the circuit's input wires.
